Plotting Interpolated spatial distribution of electric potentials measured from a sensor array
<p>I have a small footprint EEG measurement device with 8 measurement electrodes and 1 reference electrode - the reference electrode is in the center of the sensor array, 4 measurement electrodes on the corners of the 2cm x 2cm sensor array and 4 measurement electrodes in the center of the faces of the square making a pattern as given below,</p> <p>X X X</p> <p>X X X</p> <p>X X X </p> <p>Now, if I take a single or 10 contiguous and concurrent set of time samples of voltage levels from each of these 8 spatial channels, how do I create a MATLAB plot or scatter plot of Interpolated distribution of electric potentials with "hot" and "cold" regions as shown in the attached figure ?</p> <p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/UnKaq.jpg" alt="Spatial_Distribution_UHD_EEG">.</p> <p>Source: <a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1053811913012615" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1053811913012615</a></p> <p>Any suggestion on achieving the above would be of great help. </p>
<pre><code>M=-1+2*rand(3) %// sample data [x,y]=meshgrid(0:0.5:1); %// grid for sample data [X,Y]=meshgrid(0:0.005:1); %// grid to interpolate onto IN=interp2(x,y,M,X,Y); %// interpolate data onto finer grid </code></pre> <p>Now the plotting (note I defined a new colormap that roughly matches with your example, it's at the bottom of the answer, just define it before doing <code>colormap(MAP)</code> if you want to use it).</p> <pre><code>colormap(MAP) surf(X,Y,IN,'EdgeColor','none') %// create the surface plot caxis([-1 1]) %// set color axxis range colorbar shading interp view([0 90]) %// put view right on top of plot, looking straight down </code></pre> <p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/hnbzf.png" alt="enter image description here"></p> <pre><code>MAP = [... 0 1.000000000000000 1.000000000000000 0 0.952380955219269 1.000000000000000 0 0.904761910438538 1.000000000000000 0 0.857142865657806 1.000000000000000 0 0.809523820877075 1.000000000000000 0 0.761904776096344 1.000000000000000 0 0.714285731315613 1.000000000000000 0 0.666666686534882 1.000000000000000 0 0.619047641754150 1.000000000000000 0 0.571428596973419 1.000000000000000 0
